page.title: 01Wray, Botton, Roeburndale
page.content: Wray-with-Botton is a long strip of hillside land along the River Hindburn. Wray village occupies the level ground at the foot of the hills at the northern end. Botton is an unspoilt area of woodland and moorland, with scattered farms. The Hindburn is bridged on the road to Millhouses, a cluster of houses and a former bobbin mill, and at Furnessford Bridge, a pretty spot. The Hindburn joins the River Roeburn at Wray. The Roeburn flows down from the Roeburndale fells, through woodland, pasture and rugged scenery. Roads lead out of Wray to Roeburndale East and West, but this quiet and lovely dale, with its old farmhouses, is best explored on foot. Most walks in and around Wray give fine views of the surrounding fells with Ingleborough to the east.
